official-title.#text:
To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to require the public disclosure of crop insurance premium
			 subsidies made on behalf of Members of Congress and their immediate
			 families, Cabinet Secretaries and their immediate families, and entities
			 of which any such individual or combination of such individuals is a
			 majority shareholder, and to require the public disclosure of the
			 underwriting gains earned by private insurance provider and the business
			 expenses covered by the Federal Government.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Stop Hiding Congressional Farm Subsidies Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Stop Hiding Congressional Farm Subsidies Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following new paragraphs:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 502(c) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act

header.#text:
Disclosure of crop insurance premium subsidies made on behalf of Members of Congress and certain
			 other individuals and entities

text.#text:
the name of each individual or entity specified in subparagraph (B) who obtained a federally
			 subsidized crop insurance, livestock, or forage policy or plan of
			 insurance (other than a catastrophic risk protection plan offered under

the amount of premium subsidy received by that individual or entity from the Corporation for such
			 policy or plan of insurance; and

the amount of any Federal portion of indemnities paid in the event of a loss during that fiscal
			 year for policy or plan of insurance.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make available to
			 the public, on an annual basis—

text.#text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1) or any other provision of law, the
Members of Congress and their immediate families.
Cabinet Secretaries and their immediate families.

Entities of which any individual described in clause (i) or (ii), or a combination of such
			 individuals, is a majority shareholder.
Subparagraph (A) applies with respect to the following:

header.#text:
Disclosure of crop insurance premium subsidies made on behalf of Members of Congress and Cabinet
			 Secretaries
Disclosure of benefits for private insurance providers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall make available to
			 the public, on an annual basis, regarding each private insurance provider,
			 by name—

text.#text: Notwithstanding paragraph (1) or any other provision of law, the

the underwriting gains earned through participation in the federally subsidized crop insurance
			 program; and

the amount paid under this subtitle for administrative and operating expenses, any Federal portion
			 of indemnities and reinsurance, and any other purpose.
